required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Montelukast in Perennial Allergic Rhinitis - 2001-2002 Study (0476-246)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Group Study Investigating the Clinical Effects of Montelukast in Patients With Perennial Allergic Rhinitis

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the ability of montelukast to improve the signs and symptoms of perennial allergic rhinitis compared to placebo. Cetirizine is included in the study as an active control.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Daytime Nasal Symptoms Score
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and first 4 weeks of a 6-week treatment period
primary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline in Daytime Nasal Symptoms score. Patients were asked to rate each nasal symptom of Congestion, Rhinorrhea, Itching, and Sneezing daily on a 4-point scale [Score 0 (best) to 3 (worst)]. The average of the 4 individual nasal symptoms scores was reported as the Daytime Nasal Symptoms Score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Nighttime Symptoms Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and first 4 weeks in 6-week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Mean change from baseline in Nighttime Symptoms Score. Patients were asked to rate each symptom daily on a 4-point scale [Score 0 (best) to 3 (worst)], and the average score of Nasal Congestion Upon Awakening, Difficulty Going to Sleep, and Nighttime Awakenings was reported as the Nighttime Symptoms Score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Composite Symptoms Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and first 4 weeks in 6-week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: Composite Symptoms Scores were computed as the average of the Daytime Nasal Symptoms Scores [Score 0 (best) to 3 (worst)]. and Nighttime Symptoms Scores collected [Score 0 (best) to 3 (worst)].

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient's Global Evaluation of Allergic Rhinitis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of the first 4 weeks in 6-week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: An evaluation by the patient, administered at week 4 of the study (or upon discontinuation) using a 7-point scale [Score 0 (best) to 6 (worst)], of the change in symptoms as compared to the beginning of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician's Global Evaluation of Allergic Rhinitis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of the first 4 weeks in 6-week treatment period
secondary_outcome.description: An evaluation by the physician, administered at week 4 of the study (or upon discontinuation) using a 7-point scale [Score 0 (best) to 6 (worst)], of the change in symptoms as compared to the beginning of the study.

intervention.description: montelukast 10 mg tablet orally once daily at bedtime for 6 weeks
cetirizine 10 mg tablet orally once daily at bedtime for 6 weeks
placebo tablet orally once daily at bedtime for 6 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient has a documented clinical history of perennial allergic rhinitis
- Patient is a nonsmoker
- Patient is in good general health
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient is hospitalized
- Patient is a woman who is <8 weeks postpartum or is breast-feeding
- Patient is a current or past abuser of alcohol or illicit drugs

link.description: MedWatch - FDA maintained medical product safety Information
Merck: Patient & Caregiver U.S. Product Web Site

results_reference.citation: Philip G, Williams-Herman D, Patel P, Weinstein SF, Alon A, Gilles L, Tozzi CA, Dass SB, Reiss TF. Efficacy of montelukast for treating perennial allergic rhinitis. Allergy Asthma Proc. 2007 May-Jun;28(3):296-304.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: 74 study sites in the United States Primary Therapy: Nov-2001 to May-2002
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients who required excluded medication and those who did not meet a minimum predefined level of combined daytime rhinitis symptoms score during the run-in period were excluded from randomization.

group.title: Montelukast 10 mg
group.description: Montelukast 10-mg film-coated tablet and cetirizine matching-image placebo tablet orally once daily at bedtime for 6 weeks.

group.title: Cetirizine 10 mg
group.description: Montelukast matching-image placebo tablet and cetirizine 10-mg tablet orally once daily at bedtime for 6 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Montelukast matching-image placebo tablet and cetirizine matching-image placebo tablet orally once daily at bedtime for 6 weeks.

group.title: Montelukast 10 mg
group.description: Montelukast 10-mg film-coated tablet and cetirizine matching-image placebo tablet orally once daily at bedtime for 6 weeks.

group.title: Cetirizine 10 mg
group.description: Montelukast matching-image placebo tablet and cetirizine 10-mg tablet orally once daily at bedtime for 6 weeks.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Montelukast matching-image placebo tablet and cetirizine matching-image placebo tablet orally once daily at bedtime for 6 weeks.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Composite Symptoms score
measure.description: Composite Symptoms Scores were computed as the average of the Daytime Nasal Symptoms Scores [Score 0 (best) to 3 (worst)] and Nighttime Symptoms Scores [Score 0 (best) to 3 (worst)].

measure.title: Daytime Nasal Symptoms score
measure.description: Patients were asked to rate each of 4 nasal symptoms of Congestion, Rhinorrhea, Itching, and Sneezing daily on a 4-point scale [Score 0 (best) to 3 (worst)]. The average of the 4 individual nasal symptom scores was reported as the Daytime Nasal Symptoms Score.

measure.title: Nighttime Symptoms score
measure.description: Patients were asked to rate each of 3 symptoms of Nasal Congestion Upon Awakening, Difficulty Going to Sleep, and Nighttime Awakenings daily on a 4-point scale [Score 0 (best) to 3 (worst)], and the average score of the 3 symptoms was reported as the Nighttime Symptoms Score.

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Daytime Nasal Symptoms Score
outcome.description: Mean change from baseline in Daytime Nasal Symptoms score. Patients were asked to rate each nasal symptom of Congestion, Rhinorrhea, Itching, and Sneezing daily on a 4-point scale [Score 0 (best) to 3 (worst)]. The average of the 4 individual nasal symptoms scores was reported as the Daytime Nasal Symptoms Score.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and first 4 weeks of a 6-week treatment period
outcome.population: All patients who had a baseline and at least one posttreatment measurement were included.

outcome.title: Patient's Global Evaluation of Allergic Rhinitis
outcome.description: An evaluation by the patient, administered at week 4 of the study (or upon discontinuation) using a 7-point scale [Score 0 (best) to 6 (worst)], of the change in symptoms as compared to the beginning of the study.
outcome.time_frame: End of the first 4 weeks in 6-week treatment period
outcome.population: The primary efficacy analyses were based on the intention-to-treat (all-patients-treated) principle. Since only 1 measurement was obtained during the treatment period, no missing values were imputed.

reported_events.time_frame: During the 6 week, double-blind treatment period, and up to and including 14 days after the last dose of study therapy
reported_events.desc: The number of patients listed in the Adverse Event tables (613 in the placebo group, 630 in the montelukast group, and 122 in the cetirizine group) is the number of patients who received study treatment.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Merck agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Merck supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
